intro: Sericostachys, commonly known as the silverleaf panic grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It is native to various regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plants typically have narrow, silver- or gray-hued leaves that reflect sunlight, a characteristic adaptation to reduce water loss. Sericostachys species are often used in ornamental horticulture due to their attractive foliage and drought tolerance. They produce small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the grass family.
